intro: Muellerina, commonly known as the silver fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its distinctive silver-white undersides on its leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with small, aromatic leaves. Muellerina species are known for their ability to thrive in sandy soils and tolerate salt spray. The flowers are usually small and white or pink, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months.
